page.title: 09Working At Wigan Hospice
page.content: Wigan Hospice was opened in 1983. It is a cross between a hotel and a hospital. It depends on public donations as the stay of a patient is free. There are 3 wards, registered for 10 beds. Monday and Thursday are for day care patients. Usually there are about 5 or 6. My mum is a nurse on night duty at Wiganspice. She arrives at 8.50pm and changes into her uniform. Then she goes to the nursing station for a report which takes about 20 minutes. At 9.30 the patients are settled down for the night. Each patient has a buzzer to ring the nurse. My mum has one hour off during the night. At 7.00am the lights are switched on and the patients are got ready for breakfast. The day staff arrive at 7.50. At 8.00am my mum comes home. Lisa Carney and Matthew Fairhurst, St. Jude's School.
